title: How to Play a Video in a Zoom Meeting

steps.title: Join or create a Zoom meeting.
steps.content: Join or create a Zoom meeting. For more information on joining a meeting, refer to How to Join a Zoom Meeting on PC or Mac .

steps.title: Open the video in another application or browser window.
steps.content: Open the video in another application or browser window. For example, if you want to share a video you downloaded to your computer, double-click the video file to open it in the default video player (such as Windows Media Player or Quicktime). You don't have to start playing the video just yetâ€”if the video plays automatically, click the pause button.

steps.title: Click Share Screen in your Zoom meeting.
steps.content: Click Share Screen in your Zoom meeting. It's a green button at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Check the box next to "Optimize Screen Sharing for Video Clip.
steps.content: Check the box next to "Optimize Screen Sharing for Video Clip. " When you click this box, the box next to "Share computer sound" checks off too, which will ensure your audience hears the video sound.

steps.title: Click the window or application containing your video.
steps.content: Click the window or application containing your video. You'll see all the screens you can share, including your Zoom screen and any tabs and windows you have open in a web browser, like YouTube. [1] X Research source You'll be able to tell which one contains your video based on the small preview image.

steps.title: Click Share.
steps.content: Click Share . Once you share the selected screen, the participants in the Zoom meeting will see what you've selected. For example, if you selected a YouTube page in the previous step, the participants in the Zoom meeting will see the YouTube page in your web browser. You can click the full-screen icon in the bottom right corner of the YouTube video to make it full-screen. If you paused the video earlier, return to it now and click Play to start it. When you want to stop sharing, click Stop Share at the top of your screen. [2] X Research source
